In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

You can use the built-in `Dates` module to extract the year and month from your DateTime object, then create a new column in your DataFrame with these values. Here is how you can do this using Julia:

```julia
using DataFrames
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> DateFormat.format(x, "yyyymm"), df[:dt]) |> collect
end
```
In this function `add_yearmonth`, we are creating a new column `:ym` in the DataFrame using the map function which takes every value from the `:dt` column and applies the anonymous function to it. The anonymous function uses `DateFormat.format(x, "yyyymm")` to format the DateTime as a string `"yyyymm"`.

Make sure you have the following packages installed: DataFrames, Dates.
